snippet: President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China ended two days of informal meetings, moving closer on pressuring a nuclear North Korea, but remaining divided over cyberespionage.
abstract: Pres Obama and Chinese Pres Xi Jinping end two days of informal meetings; move closer on pressuring nuclear North Korea and addressing climate change, but remain sharply divided over cyberespionage and other issues that have divided two countries for years; both leaders pledge to build 'a new model' of relations.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and STEVEN LEE MYERS

lead_paragraph: President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China ended two days of informal meetings, moving closer on pressuring a nuclear North Korea, but remaining divided over cyberespionage.

headline.seo: U.S. and China Pledge New Model of Cooperation
headline.main: U.S. and China Move Closer on North Korea, but Not on Cyberespionage
headline.print_headline: Divisions Aside, U.S. and China Moving Closer
